a-frame vr scene, TMNT clone
Make sure everything is in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

Creating a simple A-Frame VR scene inspired by the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (TMNT) can be done using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript all embedded in a single file. Below is an example of how you can set this up. This example includes a basic scene with a turtle character and some elements that evoke the TMNT theme. ```html TMNT Clone VR Scene

TMNT VR Scene

Use your mouse or touch to look around!

``` ### Explanation: - **A-Frame Library**: The scene uses the A-Frame library, which is included via a CDN link. - **Sky**: A blue sky is created using the `` element. - **Turtle Characters**: Simple green boxes represent turtles. You can replace these with more complex models if desired. - **Lighting**: Ambient and directional lights are added to illuminate the scene. - **Text and Image**: A text element displays "Cowabunga!" and an image of the TMNT logo is included. ### Usage: 1. Copy the code above into a text editor. 2. Save the file with a `.html` extension (e.g., `tmnt_vr_scene.html`). 3. Open the file in a web browser that supports WebVR (like Chrome or Firefox) to view the scene. Feel free to modify the colors, shapes, and positions to create a more detailed and personalized TMNT-inspired VR experience!
